item.title: If The Individual Insurance Market Crashes, Can People Still Get Coverage?
item.description: June 7, 2017 - The Trump administration is putting pressure on the fragile market for individuals who buy their own health coverage, which will almost certainly mean higher prices and fewer choices next year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 7, 2017 - The Trump administration is putting pressure on the fragile market for individuals who buy their own health coverage, which will almost certainly mean higher prices and fewer choices next year. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/07/531885293/if-the-individual-insurance-market-crashes-can-people-still-get-coverage

item.title: 'The Trump 10': Packing On The Pounds In An Age Of Stressful Politics
item.description: June 7, 2017 - Think of it as the political version of the Freshman 15. Nowadays, some people who are unhappy with the current political environment are complaining of stress-induced eating and weight gain.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 7, 2017 - Think of it as the political version of the Freshman 15. Nowadays, some people who are unhappy with the current political environment are complaining of stress-induced eating and weight gain. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/07/531859819/the-trump-10-packing-on-the-pounds-in-an-age-of-stressful-politics

item.title: Hospitals Are Partnering With Lawyers To Treat Patients' Legal Needs
item.description: June 6, 2017 - Roughly 300 health care systems around the country have set up medical-legal collaborations to help patients solve legal problems that can affect their health — at little or no cost to the patients.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - Roughly 300 health care systems around the country have set up medical-legal collaborations to help patients solve legal problems that can affect their health — at little or no cost to the patients. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/06/531760445/hospitals-are-partnering-with-lawyers-to-treat-patients-legal-needs

item.title: Lawmakers Consider Tough New Penalties For Opioid Crimes, Bucking Trend
item.description: June 6, 2017 - A bipartisan team of lawmakers has been drafting a bill that would create new sentencing guidelines for people who sell and distribute synthetic opioid drugs blamed for a steep rise in U.S. overdoses.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - A bipartisan team of lawmakers has been drafting a bill that would create new sentencing guidelines for people who sell and distribute synthetic opioid drugs blamed for a steep rise in U.S. overdoses. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/06/531787093/lawmakers-consider-tough-new-penalties-for-opioid-crimes-bucking-trend

item.title: He Called Himself An 'Honorary Woman': Remembering A U.N. Crusader
item.description: June 6, 2017 - Dr. Babatunde Osotimehin, who died on Sunday, was the director of the U.N.s lead agency on family planning and maternal health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - Dr. Babatunde Osotimehin, who died on Sunday, was the director of the U.N.s lead agency on family planning and maternal health. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/06/531743870/he-called-himself-an-honorary-woman-remembering-a-u-n-crusader

item.title: Protected But Priced Out: Patients Worry About Health Law's Future In Arizona
item.description: June 6, 2017 - Corinne Bobbie has a love-hate relationship with the Affordable Care Act. As the GOP tries to repeal the law, the experiences and fears of voters like Bobbie could determine a politician's fate.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - Corinne Bobbie has a love-hate relationship with the Affordable Care Act. As the GOP tries to repeal the law, the experiences and fears of voters like Bobbie could determine a politician's fate. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/06/530846989/protected-but-priced-out-patients-worry-about-health-laws-future-in-arizona

item.title: Plumbing In Hospitals And Nursing Homes Can Spread Legionnaires' Disease
item.description: June 6, 2017 - The CDC says health care facilities such as nursing homes and hospitals need to work harder to prevent contamination with the bacterium that causes the potentially life-threatening form of pneumonia.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - The CDC says health care facilities such as nursing homes and hospitals need to work harder to prevent contamination with the bacterium that causes the potentially life-threatening form of pneumonia. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/06/531731438/plumbing-in-hospitals-and-nursing-homes-can-spread-legionnaires-disease

item.title: Feds To Waive Penalties For Some Who Signed Up Late For Medicare
item.description: June 6, 2017 - People who mistakenly stayed on marketplace health plans after they qualified for Medicare may be eligible to have Medicare penalties reduced or waived, if they apply for the waiver by Sept. 30.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - People who mistakenly stayed on marketplace health plans after they qualified for Medicare may be eligible to have Medicare penalties reduced or waived, if they apply for the waiver by Sept. 30. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/06/531263277/feds-to-waive-penalties-for-some-who-signed-up-late-for-medicare

item.title: Disability Advocates Fear Impact Of Medicaid Cuts In GOP Health Plan
item.description: June 6, 2017 - Evan Nodvin has lived on his own since after high school. But since he has Down syndrome, he does that with help from Medicaid. The Trump administration is threatening deep cuts to the program.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - Evan Nodvin has lived on his own since after high school. But since he has Down syndrome, he does that with help from Medicaid. The Trump administration is threatening deep cuts to the program. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/06/530025557/disability-advocates-fear-impact-of-medicaid-cuts-in-gop-health-plan

item.title: What's The Rate Of Smoking In The 13- To 15-Year-Old Crowd?
item.description: June 5, 2017 - A lot of them smoke, though percentages vary widely from country to country for various reasons. When cigarettes sell for 10 cents each, that's definitely a boost for smoking.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - A lot of them smoke, though percentages vary widely from country to country for various reasons. When cigarettes sell for 10 cents each, that's definitely a boost for smoking. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/05/531045350/whats-the-rate-of-smoking-in-the-13-to-15-year-old-crowd

item.title: Babies Sleep Better In Their Own Rooms After 4 Months, Study Finds
item.description: June 5, 2017 - The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that infants sleep in their parents' room for at least six months. But some experts say scientific evidence does not back up the guidelines.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that infants sleep in their parents' room for at least six months. But some experts say scientific evidence does not back up the guidelines. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/05/531582634/babies-sleep-better-in-their-own-rooms-after-4-months-study-finds

item.title: Wisconsin Family Stays Together With Help From Medicaid
item.description: June 5, 2017 - While Medicaid is best known as a health care program for poor people, more than 80 percent of its budget goes to care for elderly people, disabled people and children.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - While Medicaid is best known as a health care program for poor people, more than 80 percent of its budget goes to care for elderly people, disabled people and children. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/05/531572792/wisconsin-family-stays-together-with-help-from-medicaid

item.title: Fewer Women Need To Undergo Repeat Surgery After Lumpectomy
item.description: June 5, 2017 - A change in guidelines for lumpectomy surgery in 2014 has already reduced the number of women undergoing additional surgery, including mastectomy, by 16 percent.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - A change in guidelines for lumpectomy surgery in 2014 has already reduced the number of women undergoing additional surgery, including mastectomy, by 16 percent. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/05/531583177/fewer-women-need-to-undergo-repeat-surgery-after-lumpectomy

item.title: The Senate's 4 Big Problems With Health Care
item.description: June 5, 2017 - Congress returns Monday from the Memorial Day recess without any discernible progress in the Senate on health care legislation — and time is getting short.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - Congress returns Monday from the Memorial Day recess without any discernible progress in the Senate on health care legislation — and time is getting short. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/05/531221275/the-senates-4-big-problems-with-health-care

item.title: In Texas, Abstinence-Only Programs May Contribute To Teen Pregnancies
item.description: June 5, 2017 - Teenage pregnancy rates have declined across the country, but some parts of Texas have made much less progress on that. Abstinence-only sex ed policies may be one reason why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - Teenage pregnancy rates have declined across the country, but some parts of Texas have made much less progress on that. Abstinence-only sex ed policies may be one reason why. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/05/530922642/in-texas-abstinence-only-programs-may-contribute-to-teen-pregnancies
